content: 1 little lizard by karrie gibbons material medium 4 weight yarn- colour of your choice tapestry needle polyester fill for stuffing 8mm safety eyes- colour of your choice hook size e/3 50mm index single_crochet= single_crochet double_crochet= double_crochet round= round st= stitch sts= stitches increase=increase decrease= decrease chain= chain slip_stitch= slip stich head/body/tail round 1 start 4 single_crochet in magic_ring or chain 4 and join 4 round 2 increase in each st 8 2 round 3 increase in next st single_crochet in next st repeat around 12 round 4 increase in next st single_crochet in next 2 sts repeat around 16 round 5 increase in next st single_crochet in next 3 sts repeat around 20 round 6-8 single_crochet in each st around 20 round 7 decrease single_crochet in next 3 repeat around 16 round 8 decrease single_crochet in next 2 repeat around 12 round 9 increase in each st 24 round 10-19 single_crochet in each st 24 round 20 decrease single_crochet in next 4 sts repeat around 20 round 21 decrease single_crochet in next 3 sts repeat around 16 round 22-26 single_crochet in each st 16 insert and secure the safety eyes stuff the body continue stuffing as you go round 27 decrease single_crochet in next 2 sts 12 round 28-30 single_crochet in each st 12 round 31 decrease single_crochet in next st repeat around 8 round 32-34 single_crochet in each st 8 3 round 35 decrease around 4 fasten_off eyelids make 2 1 chain 4 turn 2 start in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in next 3 chain fasten_off and leave tail for sewing leg make 4 to create the toes chain 4 leave tail for sewing slip_stitch to 1st st from hook chain 4 again and slip_stitch to base repeat once more creates 3 toes to create arm chain 4 from base of toes and join the 4 chain to create small circle single_crochet in each st around until arms measure 1 4 fasten_off and leave tail for sewing use tail from 1st chain to secure toes to the arm weave in ends 4 finishing sew eyelids just above the safety eyes it is ok if they overlap the safety eyes a little sew the four legs to the body about 4 row apart weave in all ends
